summary: The concept of "flour-milling works," categorized under agri-foodstuffs, refers to facilities engaged in the processing of grain into flour. This term is a redirect to the preferred term "flour milling," which encompasses the entire milling process, including the preparation, grinding, and packaging of flour products. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, flour milling is subject to various food safety standards and quality regulations to ensure consumer protection and product integrity. Compliance with these regulations is essential for maintaining market access within the EU, highlighting the importance of flour-milling works in the agri-food sector.
